thread.title_full: Two cadets from Fayette County graduate from ChalleNGe Academy | Education | register-herald.com

title: Two cadets from Fayette County graduate from ChalleNGe Academy | Education | register-herald.com
text: Two cadets from Fayette County graduated from the Mountaineer ChalleNGe Academy on Friday, Dec. 15, at Camp Dawson in Kingwood. Cadet Elija Matthew Canada, son of Matthew and Julie Canada of Victor, was in Platoon 1. Cadet Canada was recognized for receiving the Good Conduct Award, Mentorship Award, S2C Award as well as obtaining the six Individual Values Recognition Ribbons. Cadet Annie Esther-Jo Taylor, daughter of Shawn Taylor-Hypes and Howard Hypes of Powellton and Steven Taylor also of Powellton, was in Platoon 4. Cadet Taylor was recognized for receiving the Instructor's List, Mentorship Award as well as obtaining the six Individual Values Recognition Ribbons. The class was the 61st class to complete this West Virginia National Guard Program. A total of 101 graduates from 30 counties across the state successfully completed the requirements for graduation. Delegate Moore Capito congratulated the Cadets and gave the commencement address. Cadets in this class provided 4,632.55 hours of service to community for such organizations as Food for Preston, American Red Cross, Gold Star, Trout for Cheat, Wreaths Across America and the PCLA Awards Banquet. Following graduation, the cadets will begin a one-year post-residential phase of ChalleNGe that includes placement activities in education and/or employment.
